sentences.sContent: The government’s plans have caused considerable consternation among many Americans.
sentences.sCn: 政府的计划在许多美国人中间引起了相当大的恐慌。

sentences.sContent: A new power station is being built much to the consternation of environmental groups (= they are very worried about it ) .
sentences.sCn: 一座新的发电厂正在建造中，这使环境保护团体大为震惊。

remMethod.val: con + stern(僵硬) + ation → 全身僵硬 → 惊骇

trans.tranCn: 惊愕, 恐怖, 惊惶失措
trans.tranOther: a feeling of worry, shock, or fear
